title: How to Use a Yarn Winder

steps.title: Securely attach your ball winder to the edge of a counter or table.
steps.content: Securely attach your ball winder to the edge of a counter or table. Square edges are best. To avoid damage to your counter/table, you may want to place a piece of cloth between the ball winder and the counter.

steps.title: Find the end of your yarn.
steps.content: Find the end of your yarn. This can be tricky. Have patience.

steps.title: Attach the end of your yarn to the notch in your yarn winder.
steps.content: Attach the end of your yarn to the notch in your yarn winder. (Refer to your item's directions to see how to do this. Every ball winder is a little bit different!)

steps.title: Slowly begin winding.
steps.content: Slowly begin winding. You will want to do this slowly at first to get used to how the yarn winds. Different fibers react different ways.

steps.title: Continue winding, always in the same direction, slowly.
steps.content: Continue winding, always in the same direction, slowly. If you go too fast, the yarn may get caught in the gears below (on some models.)

steps.title: After you have wound all the yarn, you should decide if you want a center-pull ball or an outside-pull ball.
steps.content: After you have wound all the yarn, you should decide if you want a center-pull ball or an outside-pull ball.

steps.title: If you want a center-pull, hold the end of the yarn coming from the middle with one hand, and gently ease off the ball.
steps.content: If you want a center-pull, hold the end of the yarn coming from the middle with one hand, and gently ease off the ball.

steps.title: If you want an outer-pull, put your thumb on top of the yarn coming from the center, and gently ease off the ball.
steps.content: If you want an outer-pull, put your thumb on top of the yarn coming from the center, and gently ease off the ball.

steps.title: Put it on your skein winder/the back of a chair/your friends hands.
steps.content: Put it on your skein winder/the back of a chair/your friends hands.
